ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest12: The &eSeared Melter &rand &eSeared Heater&r can be used as a compacted and rudimentary way to melt metals into liquids.
The melter can be fueled using furnace fuels, though stronger ores may require fueling the melter using liquid lava.
&eHint:&r This will be needed for the next quest!
Craft a &eSeared Melter&r and &eSeared Ingot Tank
&eThe Foundry&r is a multi-block structure and alternative to the smeltery.
It will not alloy, allowing for bulk storage of ores without worrying about accidental mixtures.
&e&lTip:&r Ores melted in the foundry will produce byproducts, granting a more valuable resource than the original ore.
&6&lHint:&r Unlike The Smeltery, &eThe Foundry&r requires blocks on its edges and corners!
Craft the blocks needed and build a &eTinker's Foundry
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest17: &e&lTip:&r Packs a heavy punch at the cost of some movement speed.
&dYou can cast an Ingot or a Part for this quest!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest23: Using the &eSeared Melter&r create a &eSmeltery Controller&r by pouring molten copper over &eSeared Bricks
&e&lHint:&r This will be needed for the next quest!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest25: Whilst smelting down Blazes from a spawner, you may occasionally come across the &eJolt&r, an annoying variant of the Blaze that can teleport around and out of your smeltery through lightning when hurt, leaving behind fire wherever he strikes down at. Luckily there is one thing lightning can't resist - a &elightning rod&r!
Simply have one nearby and all &eJolts&r attempting to teleport will strike down at the &elightning rod&r instead!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest28: &eHepatizon&r is a powerful material that temporarily increases your Mining Speed a bit the longer you mine!
&dYou can cast an Ingot or a Part for this quest!
&e&lTip:&r Slimy Materials (like Slimesteel!) allow for Overslime to be applied to tools with out inccurring any penalties
&dYou can cast an Ingot or a Part for this quest!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest30: &e&lTip:&r Gems can give a variety of effects, read up on how they can help you!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest33: Try all the available &eupgrades &rand &eabilities! &rExplore what every mod has to offer in the world of &6Tinkers' Construct!
&l&eTip:&r Antimatter pellets can be used as both a material and upgrade component. Using it as a tool material won't allow for you to upgrade your tool with it.
&6Theory will only take you so far...
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest38: &eThe Smeltery&r is a multi-block structure used in the creation of higher-tier weapons and tools using metal and alloys.
&e&lTip:&r Raw metals smelted in a Tinker's Smeltery produce a little extra! Ore blocks smelted produce double!
&e&lTip:&r Increasing the size of your Smeltery will also increase Fuel usage per smelt.
&6&lHint:&r Adding extra layers of &eSeared Bricks&r will increase the Smeltery's capacity!
For more detailed information, read &eMighty Smelting&r.
Craft the blocks needed and build a &eTinker's Smeltery
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest39: Create a Tool with 21 or more Base Damage
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest40: Slime allows for you to apply the Overslime ability to your tools
Overslime when applied to tools consume overslime instead of durability, it can be reapplied by combining the tool with more slime.
&6&lHint:&r Tools not made of slime can have Overslime applied, but at a small cost to their Stats!
&e&lTip:&r Different colors of slime each have their own purpose, so try to collect them all.
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest44: &eManyullyn&r is a powerful material that temporarily boosts your Damage dealt a bit with every hit you give or deal! (depending on if it's in your Weapon or Armor!)
&dYou can cast an Ingot or a Part for this quest!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest49: Using the &eSmeltery&r create a &eFoundry Controller&r by pouring molten cobalt over &eScorched Bricks
&e&lHint:&r This will be needed for the next quest!
&e&lTip:&r Need to undo a modifier or ability? No need to scrap your Tool! simply remove it!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest55: Tinkersâ€™ Construct is a mod about creating tools, then modifying them to make them better. The tools will never permanently break, allowing you to tinker with a design until you are satisfied, or recycle them into new tools. After creating your first tools, create a smeltery to upgrade your tool creation, and explore the world to unlock more powerful materials and modifiers.
&e&lHint:&r The most useful Tinkers' Construct guide books can be recieved by completing the eccentric tome quest!
Craft a full set of &eTraveler's Gear
Applies the Soul Bound effect to any tool it is applied to, costs one upgrade slot.
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest60: The &e&nPart Builder&r is used to create parts for tools! Parts are needed to assemble tools! The parts you use will determine the strength, speed, durability and special traits of your tool!
The &e&nTool Station&r is used to assemble tool parts into fully fledged basic tools!
The &e&nPart Chest&r is used to store unused parts!
&l&eTip:&r When these blocks are touching, they will share their inventories! Making it easier to move items between them.
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest61: &e&lTip:&r Ichor can also be melted into down &6Blazing Blood&r!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest64: Enchanted Alloy is a magical material that gives tools &dVeinminer
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest65: The &eTinker's Anvil&r is an upgraded form of the &eTinker Station&r, which can also assemble &6Broad Tools&r!
&6Broad Tools&r are more powerful, such as having &dAoE Mining&r and doing &dmore Damage per hit&r, but tend to have slower speeds.
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest67: The &eTinker's Anvil &rhaving more Slots allows you to add some new Modifiers to your tools! Try applying modifiers using your tool's &dUpgrade&r slots!
&l&6Hint:&r Try applying &cRedstone&r to one of your Tools. It'll make it a bit faster! (But only at breaking stuff!)
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest69: &e&lTip:&r Gives tools rechargeable power that can enhance the tool.
&6&lHint:&r Will require some Thermal Series set up.
&dYou can cast an Ingot or a Part for this quest!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest73: In order to create tool parts from Metals and Alloys, you first need to create a &eCast&r. These are used to forge metal tool parts!

&l&6Hint:&r First make a tool part out of stone and then place it inside a &eSeared Casting Table&r, fill the &eSmeltery&r with &eMolten Gold&r and pour the Gold over the stone tool part! Allow it to dry and you will be left with a cast! You can then pour metals into the cast to create metal/alloy tool parts! Which you can combine to craft a tool inside the &eTinker's Anvil
&l&6Hint:&r You can create ingot casts to remove metals from the smeltery! You can also pour directly into a basin to get a block of material!
&l&eTip:&r This can be repeated for all tool parts! You should ideally make a tool out of multiple materials to get increased stats and traits! There are thousands of possible tool combinations!
Need more modifiers slots? &eRose Gold &ris a material that comes with a few extra!
&eRose Gold &rcan be made by alloying gold and copper in the smeltery
&dYou can cast an Ingot or a Part for this quest!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest75: &eBlank Sand Casts &rare temporary, single-use molds made from Sand or Red Sand. Theyâ€™re quick and easy to make and are great for basic part casting.
&e&lTip:&r Don't have or want to make a part to press into a Sand Cast? Put it Part Builder to carve out the pattern in it!
Craft and use a &eBlank Sand Cast&r
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest79: Used as a slotless upgrade, giving your tool another &dAbility slot&r.
&e&lTip:&r Allows for Silk Touch to applied to mining tools at the cost of a ability slot.
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest82: &l&eTip:&r Read more about Slimeskulls and their effects in the &6Encyclopedia of Tinkering&r!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest83: Boost a Tool's Upgrade Slot count by 6 using the &dHarmonious&r, &dResurrected&r, &dWraught&r, &dCrystalline&r, and &dGilded&r modifiers!
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.quest91: To make more advanced materials from cobalt, you will want to acquire some &eblazing blood &rfrom melting a blaze. The easiest way to do this is to trick newly spawned blazes into a smeltery, though you can also craft weapons capable of extracting &eblazing blood &rfrom live blazes.
&l&6Hint:&r Another way to obtain blazing blood is by melting down ichor. You will need a bit of &eblazing blood &rto get started, but I heard you can obtain some from bartering with piglins.
&eBathing in the Blood of my Blazes
Craft a full set of &eTinkers' Plate Armor
ftbquests.chapter.6modular_tools.title: &7Tinker's Construct!
ftbquests.chapter.6nvampirism__vampire.q: The Vampire Forest biome can only be found in a unique vampire pocket dimension, this dimension can be accessed from a portal.

Craft the Bloody Dark Stone Bricks and then place them on the ground around a 2x2 hole as shown in the image below.  Right click on the portal with a bottle of Vampire Blood (kill vampires with a stake) to activate.

After using Vampire Fangs you will receive a potion effect called "Sanguinare Vampiris" which lasts about a Minecraft day. After the potion has ended, you become a vampire. In case you don't want to become one, you can always cancel the effect with a milk bucket.
&oBy Right Clicking Vampire Fangs you can begin the Vampirism process
ftbquests.chapter.9help_from_barry.quest: Are you having a hard time finding &6The Legendary Eyes&r?
Well lucky for you, it is in both of our best interests to find em!
I can sell you a &dMap&r for each of the Eyes that are in rare structures.
I will also provide you with a convenient &eWaypoint&r for your &dMinimap!
&8&oOh don't mind me! I was just rummaging through trashcans for cheese!
Barry can offer help... for a price!
&6Tip:&r Barry can also send you a &dWaypoint&r to the structure if you click the link provided in chat after claiming this quest!
Proudly brought to you by amateur cartographer Barry!

1x Amethyst Shard:&r Needed for the Compass Needle

ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest2443458359: These Eyes can be used in place of another &6Legendary Eye&r for the purpose of opening an &eEnd Portal.
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest3352049957: &eThe Ferrous Eye&r belongs to &eThe Ferrous Wroughtnaut&r. This construct is older than the rivers and the mountains! It's older than me and I'm older than old! No one really knows who built these, but they are scattered throughout The Overworld.
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest3607215615: Not much is known about &cThe Harbinger&r apart from the echos of an ancient civilization that once tried playing God. Legend says an unpowered Harbinger can be found inside one of their &eAncient Factories.&r
The nature of their disappearance will be debated until more questions can be answered.
&6&lHint:&r &cThe Harbinger&r seems incomplete, it might require some item from a powerful &4Nether&r foe... maybe it's modeled after it?
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest3755364829: Enter The End and slay the fierce &d<shake>ENDER DRAGON!
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest4161195811: &eThe Void Blossom&r is an extremely dangerous foe.
This giant overgrown plant has been sucking up all of the void energy below and has become MASSIVE!
It is said &eThe Overgrown Eye&r contains their life essence and can even be regrown after death! Also, we go waaaay back! I've known him since he was just a lil sprout in the ground!
&6Hint:&r You can find &eThe Void Blossom&r at &dBedrock
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest4404459266: In order to open a portal to &eThe End&r, you will need to seek out &lTWELVE&r (only 12 are needed) powerful items...
These items are known as &6"The Legendary Eyes"
Each Eye is said to be protected by &4&oFormidable Foes!&r Each determined to protect their respective Eye. Go forth and gather them all for &mme!&r us!
Upon collecting a &6Legendary Eye&r you will unlock a &dCrystal Skull&r in the Bosses Book to showcase your progress!
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest4408806431: &eThe Nether Gauntlet&r can be found rarely in The Nether!
Find and slay it! Make sure to keep an EYE open for any threats...
&o&7Well this block just looks only a little suspicious!
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest4531714763: Legend says &eThe Old Eye&r is protected by the &eAncient Revenant&r
I'm sending you to The Desert to seek it out!
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest5867324555: This tombstone is said to be located at the &eFrosted Prison.&r
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest7137369629: &6Questmaster:&r You've found my prized missing Salmon! Now quickly return it to me and I will grant you a wonderful reward! Quickly now!
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest7160324107: &eThe Lost Eye&r was forged at &dThe Nether Soul-Forge&r thousands of years ago... I wonder where it is? Who lost it?
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest7753466862: &eThe Frostmaw&r is a dangerous beast. &oI would never personally cross one.&r That is why I have you! Their massive size and powerful ice breath makes them near impossible opponents. It is said &eThe Frostmaw&r has &eThe Frozen Eye&r in its possession, something it protects with its life! Tread carefully...
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest7768807002: There appears to be a &e&ostrong smell&r of &e&olemon&r coming from the letter within the envelope..
You've noticed something.. odd about this letter..
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest7809013067: &6Umvuthi The Sunbird&r is said to be the living vessel for an unknown Sun God. His worshippers protect him..
An ancient prophecy says &eThe Blessed Eye&r grants him near limitless power.. Defeat him to aquire this eye! Good luck! You'll need it!
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest8432355345: Pirate lore says this item allows the user to bend the ocean to their will..
The honourable Captain Cornelia went searching for this relic over a century ago.. She was never heard from again..
Best start looking for her, she was last seen heading into the &eCold Sea!
ftbquests.chapter.bosses.quest8573039856: &4The Dead King&r possesses the &eCorrupted Eye&r and can be found in &eThe Catacombs&r Tread lightly, this foe is a master of Undead and Blood Magic!
&6Questmaster's Note:&r PS this imbecile owes me money! &oTeach him a lesson he'll never forget!

ftbquests.chapter.ccombat.quest124687206: Shields can block an attack, after blocking it will enter into a cooldown.
Shields have different stats that vary between them!
&eTip:&r Stamina will increase or decrease the number of times you can block before a cooldown is applied!
&eTip:&r Holding a shield in your off-hand will grant a passive 30%% damage reduction!
&6Hint:&r You can only block incoming damage from the direction you received it!
ftbquests.chapter.ccombat.quest232838594: Target Dummies are an excellent way to practice and figure out the best weapon combo for you!
&oCraft a Target Dummy and use it to test your DPS (Damage Per Second)
ftbquests.chapter.ccombat.quest372129649: &eTip:&r Sometimes you can fire a crit arrow! these will appear golden and do 2x damage!
ftbquests.chapter.ccombat.quest582222948: Each weapon type has their own attack animation and combos!
Depending on the weapon type (IE: sword, axe, spear) the combo multipler varies!
For example, attacking with a &dSword&r weapon type grants a 50%% damage boost every third attack on the "stab forward" animation!
Every 4th attack with two daggers does a special "dual stab" which does 350%% more damage.
Every 3rd attack with a hammer weapon type does 250%% bonus damage.
Explore and play with different weapons, some have unique attacks and combos!
ftbquests.chapter.ccombat.quest696199563: The Shield of The Deep is an excellent shield to use pre-Expert Mode!
It has great stats and durability! At the cost of movement speed however.
ftbquests.chapter.ccombat.quest713455478: You charged up your &dRage&r by taking damage consecutively or by doing damage consecutively to the same target. Your next melee attack will do bonus damage!
&6Hint:&r Entites can also become &dEnraged!&r Be careful to dodge their &oSuper-Charged attacks!
&eTip:&r Upon becoming Enraged, you will find a flurry of Critical Hit particles at your feet and will hear a distinctive Ding sound upon landing a Super-Charged Rage hit.

ftbquests.chapter.complicated_bees.quest: Some species of &6bee&r, when bred with others, will result in a brand-new species of &6bee&r! Generally these &6bees&r show as hybrids with one of the parent species, but occasionally you might get lucky and find a purebred mutation.

When an offspring &amutates&r, one whole chromosome (half of a &6bees&r genetic structure) is completely replaced with the result species' 'pure' chromosome. This means you might get some spontaneous generation of new traits - new &6bee&r effects, temperature tolerances, work speeds, and more.
Carefully breed these &amutated&r &6bees&r with your current genetic stock to get more! Keep in mind that some species are recessive, and will take more effort to breed true.

The Apid Library allows you to examine &6bees&r in your possession and determine whether they can mutate into new species. Simply place a bee in the top right slot and select a mutation on the left (if any) to see more information about it.
It'll only show the icon of &6bees&r you've already collected. It'll leave hints about unknown &6bees&r by hovering over the question mark symbol!
The analyzer lets you examine a bee's genes in-depth, as well as seeing its inactive genes; no more sneaky recessive traits ruining your ideal crossbreed!

Once made, use it to open up the analyzer interface. You'll have to place a bee in the bee slot and some honey drops in the other slot to pacify the bee and analyze it. Once you do, the bee's whole genome will be shown to you. You can see its active and inactive genes, whether a specific gene is dominant or recessive, some very special flavor text, and more!
Use this information and Punnett squares to direct your crossbreeding efforts, and create the ultimate bee!
Working as a &6beekeeper&r sure gets you hungry!
&dAmbrosia&r is a very useful food as it gives you multiple buffs keeping you fresh and healthy! Upon eating &dAmbrosia&r you gain Regenation 2, Jump Boost 3 and Absorption 2!

&6The Bee Sorter&r is able to classify and sort &6bees&r that get piped into it. It can accept items from any side, taking them into its single-slot buffer, and will automatically output that item to any sides that have filters configured to match the item.
Interact with the block to open the GUI. Each side of the block has a color on it, which correspond to rows in the GUI.

On the left, you have type filters - click these to swap between drone, princess, queen, &6any bee, non-bee&r, and no items allowed. The remaining six slots on each row are species filters, where 0 is the primary and 1 is the secondary. You can set these by left or right clicking on the slot with a &6bee&r or dragging one from a recipe browser.

A side is selected based on how specific the filter is; for example, the bee sorter configured here will output any Forest-Plains drones to the white side, other drones with Forest as the primary species to the black side, and any other drones will be split randomly between the red and blue sides.
By default, the sorter auto-exports - &4you can disable this with redstone&r.

You'll quickly realize you have more &ehoney&r than you know what to do with. While food is all good and well, you can also burn your excess &ehoney&r (and certain other &6bee&r products) in the &eHoney&r Generator for more RF!

Frames are consumable 'upgrades' for your apiaries! Each one has a different effect when slotted into an apiary, from increasing production to outright changing environmental conditions for the bees inside it. Frames will slowly take damage as they are used, necessitating replacement every so often. Mix and match to achieve your ideal set of bonuses!
Every &6bee&r lifecycle tick, the Temperature Unit has a chance to consume specific items to increase or decrease the temperature of the Mellarium - check your JEI for possible fuels.
Complicated bee nests can spawn pretty much anywhere - In the &2jungle&r, in the &6desert&r, &8underground&r and even in The &4Nether&r and The &dEnd&r!
Once you find one just use the scoop to break a &6bee nest&r, and you'll get a princess, a couple drones, and maybe even a comb or two!
Find a Bee Nest And Break It With a Scoop

How do you get the &ehoney&r out of combs? It's a little too sticky to manually dig out of the combs cleanly, and you have MUCH better things to do with your time, I'm sure. Enter the Centrifuge: this machine will spin things really, really fast, separating them by density - in this case, your combs into &ehoney&r, wax, and other potential extra things.

However, this spinning needs something with a little more oomph than some hot air from burning things. This is where a Furnace Generator comes in - by taking hot air from burning things, you can generate RF! (or as others like to call it, Redstone Flux)
Just put a furnace generator next to a centrifuge, give it some fuel, and you'll have your centrifuge up and running in no time!
Most combs produce &e honey&r and wax, which have their uses - some combs, though, will produce special resources in addition to those.
Craft a Centrifuge and a Furnace Generator

Now that you have &6bees&r, you'll want to set them up in a house of their own, so they can start producing that sweet, sweet, &ehoney&r! An apiary is ideally suited to this task - with easily-accessible space for &6bees&r, frames, and products, this wonderful little block is a beekeeper's (or, if you're feeling fancy, an apiarist's) best friend!

Once you've located a good spot to set up shop, just plop down your apiary and place your princess in the top slot and a drone in the bottom, and you're off to the races! A princess and drone combine into a queen, which will produce combs if fully satisfied. If the bar on the left turns red, just hover over it to see what else the queen needs to be satisfied.

Now that you have a queen content with her surroundings, she'll slowly produce combs and (eventually) die, leaving behind a princess and some drones. Start the cycle all over again, and you have (theoretically) infinite&e honey&r!
The &2Mutator&r consumes one catalyst every time a queen dies to increase the chance of it producing &2mutated offspring&r - check JEI for possible catalysts.
Using the power of a &9heart of the sea&r, the Rain Shield protects &6bees&r from inclement weather!
Frame Housings can hold frames based on their tier - the basic can hold one, the regular two, and the large three. &aThese frames will stack multiplicatively!&r

&eThe Apiarist's Clothes&r can be equipped to lessen the negative effects of Bees (such as Poison from &2Tropical Bees&r). The more pieces of clothing you wear, the more often will Bees leave you alone. but they can still sometimes poison you, but that is &4very rare&r.
Craft a full set of Apiarist's Clothes
By placing &2Propolis&r in the centrifuge you'll have a change at getting a Silk Wisp!
9 of these Silk Wisps can be used to craft a Woven Mesh!
3 of these Silk Wisps can be used to craft a piece of string!
Collect enough Silk Wisps to make a Woven Mesh

Every &6bee&r lifecycle tick, the Hydroregulator has a chance to consume specific items to increase or decrease the humidity of the Mellarium, with a chance of producing a leftover - Check your JEI for said info.
Throughout your &6beekeeping&r journey you'll have to collect lots of resources such as the one marked above!
Each resource being useful in many ways - Here's how to collect these essential resources!
&eHoney Droplets&r and &eBeewax&r are produces as a by-product of every &ehoneycombs&r by placing them in a centrifuge!

&2Propolis&r and &dRoyal Jelly&r are a by-product from different &ehoneycombs&r so you'll have to cross-breed to get these! By placing the &ehoneycombs&r in a centrifudge you'll have a change at said products!
&aPollen&r are by-products from 2 certain &6bees&r by making them work in the apiary!

The Mellarium is an industrially-sized apiary, capable of housing special modules that can kick your production into high gear. It provides a &abaseline 1.25x multiplier&r to productivity which can be increased through modules.
Note that non-base mellarium blocks can not be placed in the top layer of the Mellarium.
To build it, place down a &a3x3x3 cube of mellarium blocks&r. If you've done it right, the cube will assemble like so:
&4Try not to build these across chunk borders or right next to each other.&r

The microscope is an invaluable tool for researching specimens. Place a &6bee&r in the top right slot to begin analyzing it - you'll be presented with a minigame you'll have to complete. The difficulty of the minigame is based on how complex the species is: the further into the mutation tree, the more complex a species.

To help you complete the minigame, you can place extra &6bees&r of any type or royal jelly into the highlighted slots below the specimen. These items are then consumed when you click the arrow to provide hints towards the game - the more complex a specimen, the more bees it takes to get a hint.

Once you complete the minigame, you'll research a random mutation involving the specimen's primary species. Researching a mutation grants apiaries placed by you a flat +20%% chance for the mutation to occur within them.

&6Bees&r need specific conditions to work in, which vary by species - generally, &6bees&r prefer to work in environments similar to the ones they are native to; for example, a Jungle &6bee&r would prefer a hot and humid environment. You can use a meter to measure the temperature and humidity of the surrounding areas.

&6Bees&r also need specific 'flowers' nearby, which tend to be plants native to whatever biomes the bees are native to. Azaleas, vines, dead shrubs, even skulls - all of these and more are potentially flowers that your species of &6bee&r might need.
Breaking a &6bees nest&r without a scoop will result in you getting &4stung&r in retaliation for destroying their homes.

All values of a gene (called &b'alleles'&r) are either dominant or recessive, shown in the analyzer as red or blue. When two different alleles are present within a &6bees&r genotype, a dominant &ballele&r will be active over a recessive allele.

This means to have a recessive &ballele&r be active in a &6bee&r, you have to breed in such a way that produces two recessive alleles within a &6bee&r. When there are two alleles that are both dominant or both recessive, the active &ballele&r is randomly chosen.

With enough bees producing combs, especially at an industrial scale, you'll want to start making your machines better. Ever-useful propolis and some other materials will make special modules that you can use to upgrade your machines! All machine upgrades stack multiplicatively, just like frames.

&6Here's some basics;&r
-When setting up a &eSub-Network&r, the &5Fluix Cables&r connected to your &bPrimary Network&r have two functions; &7Providing Power&r and &eImporting/Exporting&r.

--That same &5Fluix Cable&r can be used to &eImport/Export&r, by introducing a &eMediating Storage&r, such as a barrel for &eItems&r or a tank for &eFluids/Gases&r, and connecting to the &ePrimary Network&r using an &eImport Bus Filtered&r with the items your operations need, and an &eExport Bus Filtered&r with the outputs that you've produced.
*Don't forget to use a &eStorage Bus&r/&eMe Interface&r as your &eSub-Network&r needs a way to access the &eMediating Storage&r*

&eImport Bus&r on the left of the barrel to recive output, &eExport Bus&r on the top of the barrel to provide resources, &eStorage Bus&r on the front of the barrel allowing &eSub-Network&r access into Mediating Storage, &7Quartz Fiber&r on the only connecting &5Fluix Cable&r between the &eSub-Network&r and &bPrimary Network&r to provide &7Power&r.

Your &dME Controller&r is the heart of your entire Network, every machine you have used so far takes up a &eChannel&r, without a controller your &eNetwork&r is limited to &e8 Channels&r.

&6Tip:&r In order to transfer external &7Power Generation&r into &dAE2&r, all you need is an &eEnergy Acceptor&r. Just connect your acceptor to your Network, hook your power into, it and watch your battery fill!

While &e8 Channels&r is enough for early applications of &dApplied Energistics&r, as your operations begin to scale that amount will seem like nothing, and that's where your &dME Controller&r comes into play; Each of it's 6 faces provides &332 Channels&r.
&6Hint:&r Not every &dApplied Energestics&r machine uses a &eChannel&r, but every &bME (x)&r machine does.

If you haven't already, try right clicking your &dME Controller&r; It will provide you with an overwheleming amount of infromation, but once you understand what it all means it won't look so scary anymore.

Your &eNetwork&r details tell you a lot of things, the amount of &eChannels&r you have used, your &7Stored/Max Power&r, your &ePassive Drain&r which we will get to in a moment, and your &7Energy Useage/Generation&r.

While most of these are fundamental, &ePassive Drain&r is a bit more unique, most machines you connect to your system will have a minor amount of &ePassive Drain&r, but it's nothing to worry about as long as you have a power setup appropriate for your scale and you have a suitable &7Power Bank&r.

The &7Power Bank&r of your &dME Controller&r alone is insuffecent, since it cannot store a meaninful excess of energy. With &76k AE (energy)&r storage provided by your controller, you have no buffer for when multiple machine begin running. The solution? a &eEnergy Cell&r, with it's weakest iteration providing &7200k AE (energy)&r storage, a single copy will be a sufficient buffer for a long time.
With the metaphorical heart of your operation constructed you now need to &7Power&r it.
If you haven't already this is the time to make use of your &aFavorite Energy Mod&r and produce the power for your future contraptions to use.
Your First/Primary Network
If you have yet to acquire a means of producing energy, using a &eWooden Crank&r to convert manual labor into power will have to do.

&6Tip:&r If you already have a source of power (for example RF from a Thermal dynamo), You can transfer it into your machine by using an &eEnergy Acceptor&r. Try placing it adjacent to your source of power and the machine you are attempting to power.
&6Note:&r All &dApplied Energistics&r equipment will automatically link themselves to each other and allow power to flow between themselves.

You've digitized your &eStorage&r, &eFluids&r and even your &eChemicals&r, but why stop there?
With the power of the &eSpatial IO Port&r you can &adigitalize your world!&r
Your &eSpatial IO Port&r can let you digitize anything from a &eSingle Block&r to &eStructures&r spanning up to &b128x128x128 Blocks&r.
It's functions in a simple manner, find your location, and build around it using &eSpatial Pylons&r until you cover its &eLength&r, &eWidth&r and &eHeight&r.

Once you've covered your soon to be land, the only thing between you and converting it into a single slot in your inventory is charging your &eSpatial IO Port&r with enough power to complete the operation.
{image:modpack:textures/ae2_spatial_storage_setup.png width:200 height:100 align:center}
Digitizing Structures
At some point getting back to your &ePrimary Terminal&r for every other task gets repetative, and as your operation expands that downtime between going back and forth expands.
But that's what the &eWireless Terminals&r are for!
A little bit of power, a &eWireless Access Point&r later and bam; &bWireless Storage/Crafting Network&r access.
Losing the Cables
Considerably more dense than things should be, &5Singularities&r require 256k Items/Buckets to and at least a &e64k ME Storage Component&r to produce in the &eMatter Condenser&r.
&6Note:&r Before progressing into the &5Quantum&r realm, you should setup a &bStorage Network&r.
Crossing the Barrier

One of &dApplied Energistics&r' most popular uses is it's &bStorage Network&r, a method of transferring all of your items into the digital world, it's much simpler to use and expand than you expectations may have you believe.
There is another mechanic to &eStorage Cells&r related to &7Types&r; &7Bytes&r work in such a way that the &7Capacity&r of a cell is used more efficently the less &7Types&r it uses.
This is most useful when &eModifying Cells&r and shifting around &ePriorities&r which will be explained soon.
Again, the specifics aren't necessary but the &eGuide&r has a table can explain this visually. (Try holding 'G' on &eStorage Cells&r)
All of your &4*spoils of conquest*&r will be stored in &eME Item Storage Cells&r, functionally a chest with much deeper item slots.
&eStorage Cells&r are stored in &eME Drives&r which act as a holding bay for &510 Storage Cells&r per &eME Drive&r regardles of size or type.
To access your &bStorage Network&r you must use at least a &eME Terminal&r, but for most cases you want to push a step beyond and instead use a &eCrafting Terminal&r.
Not only does it allow you to access your &bStorage Network&r but it also provides an easy to use &eCrafting Table&r within the terminal.

While all &eItem Storage Cells&r only allow you to store &563 types&r of items per Storage Cell, the size of your &eStorage Cell&r (&c1k&r, &64k&r, &a16k&r etc.) allows you to scale the &7Capacity&r of those cells.

Basically, you &4do not&r want to store &enon-stacking items&r such as Swords, Armor and the various Trinkets you come across inside your &bStorage Network&r; else you risk overflowing the &7Types&r of items that you can store much earlier than the &7Capacity&r of your cells.
Before moving on, it's important to note that the &7Capacity&r of cells is not in terms of items but in terms of &7Bytes&r.
They are hard to explain and a deeper understanding of them isn't required but fundamentally &ethe more&r &7Bytes&r &eyou have, the more Items you can store.&r
{image:modpack:textures/ae2_simple_storage.png width:200 height:100 align:center}
Digital Storage
Storage Network
&5Quantum Network Bridges&r can extend a &eNetwork&r over infinite distances and even between dimensions.
They have many uses, including but not limited to; Accessing and transferring resources between connected &eNetworks&r.
The &eME Quantum Link Chamber&r is the core of a &5Quantum Network Bridge&r, and the &eME Quantum Rings&r are the interfaces through which &eNetworks&r can interact.
&6Note:&r Quantum Network Bridges allow 32 channels in total, but only &eME Quantum Rings&r adjacent to the &eME Quantum Link Chamber&r can receive and transfer information.
&8(Both sides of a Quantum Network Bridge must be continuously chunk loaded to function)&r
Beyond Wireless
Quantum Network Bridge
The &eCell Workbench&r allows you to &aAdd/Remove/Config&r &eUpgrade Cards&r from your &eStorage Cells&r and/or &ePartition&r them.
Here's an example; Say you have a Cobblestone Generator and you want to pipe it into your &bStorage Network&r.
But wait, you don't want to end up filling all of your &eStorage Cards&r with Cobblestone. What do you do?
&6Hint:&r Before you turn the page and check the answer, think of the &eUpgrade Cards&r we've introduced, could any of them achieve this task?

You could install an &aOverflow Destruction Card&r onto a &eStorage Cell&r, but before you do that you must make sure that the &eStorage Cell&r will only accept Cobblestone otherwise you risk your &bStorage Network&r eating your items. But how do we do that?

&aPartitioning&r, by placing a &eStorage Cell&r into your &eCell Workbench&r you gain the ability to &ePartition&r it's cells; This means that by placing a copy of the item(s) you want the cell to contain, you can make it exclusively accept only those items.

So now, if you have &aPartitioned&r your &eStorage Cell&r to only accept Cobblestone, &eModified&r it with an &aOverflow Destruction Card&r and set the &epriority&r of the &eME Drive&r containing it to the top of your &aChain of Priority&r, any and all Cobblestone &eImported&r into the &bStorage Network&r will fill the &eStorage Cell&r to it's &7Capacity&r and the excess will be thrown into the void instead of overflowing your &bStorage Network&r.
&6Hint:&r If you already have Cobblestone in your &bStorage Network&r, try using the &eME IO Port&r to move it all into your new &eStorage Cell&r.
Modifications
If you find yourself needing a lot of &7Capacity&r for a few &eTypes of Items&r, a larger &eStorage Cell&r may be what you need.
By default, every iteration of a &eStorage Cell&r gives you an extra (x)K worth of &7Bytes&r, with (x) being the capacity of the cell before it.
For Example, a &64k Storage Cell&r needs a &e4k Storage Component&r, but instead of needing 4x &e1k Storage Components&r to craft, you only need 3, and as such you get an extra 1k &7Bytes&r for free.

Accelerating Growth
Part of why &dApplied Energistics'&r &bStorage Network&r is so popular is it's ability to &eRequest&r the automated crafting of &9*any/everything*&r.
For &ePatterns&r that require a &eCrafting Table&r, &eCrafting Patterns&r are used.
For &ePatterns&r that require a &eSmelting/Brewing/Processing&r, &eProcessing Patterns&r are used.
For &ePatterns&r that require a &eSmithing Table&r, &eSmithing Table Patterns&r are used.
For &ePatterns&r that require a &eStone Cutter&r, &eStone Cutting Patterns&r are used.

&6Note:&r There are options for allowing/preventing &eSubstitutions&r, thease determine weather different blocks that could still fullfil the recipe (such as &eSpruce Planks&r making a chest instead of &eOak Planks&r) are permitted.
As you would expect, the &eCrafting&r, &eSmithing&r and &eStone Cutting Patterns&r are used for their respective blocks but &eProcessing Patterns&r are more unique.
Processing Patterns are special because your &eOutput&r is not restricted by your operating block.
This difference is what gives the opportunity for &eBrewing&r and other &aspecial operations to take place&r.
How that can be done is related to the nature of our &bCrafting Network&r and &ahow it operates&r, which we will get into shortly.
But for now lets focus on &eAutomated Crafting&r.
This is done through the useage of &ePatterns&r, "guides" for you machines on how to Craft, Smelt, Brew and so on.
Before we get to building your crafter's &bCPU&r, it's important to learn and understand how &ePatterns&r, their creation and their implementation works.
To begin, a &eME Pattern Encoding Terminal&r is required, it is how you can interact with a configure &eBlank Patterns&r.
When opening the terminal, you will notice that it displaces your &bStorage Network&r and the &ePattern Encoding UI&r, while it may look like it it doesn't actually work as a crafting table.
Instead it is a medium for you to insert the recipes you wish to automate and adjust their results if need be.
&6Tip:&r In order to familiarize yourself with the &ePattern Encoding Terminal&r, try and create the appropriate &ePattern&r for crafting Planks from Logs, then Planks into Sticks.
&6Hint:&r if you need to change the quantity Inputed/Outputed you can &eMiddle Mouse&r the respective item within a pattern to adjust it.

Regardless of weather or not you followed the tip, you might have noticed that on the right side of the &ePattern Enconding UI&r there are 4 options to choose from. Each of the options are there to explain to your &bCrafting Network&r what the expected &eOutput&r is for your given &eInput&r.

Priority is simple, the device with the higher &ePriority Value&r gets to go first.
What does this look like?
Imagine you have two &eME Drives&r, and for whatever reason you want one to be completely filled before the other begins to accept items.

By setting the &ePriority Value&r of the first to 1, or any value larger than the second drive's &ePriority Value&r, your &eNetwork&r will send all aplicable items to the first &eME Drive&r as long as it has room.
Once it is full, your &eNetwork&r will look to fill the next &eME Drive&r down the &aChain of Priority&r.
&6Hint:&r This is not limited to just ME Drives, almost every machine you work with will have an option for priority and they will all follow the &aChain of Priority&r.

The &eInscriber&r is our method of printing &eCircuits and Processors&r.
There are a 3 Ciruits: &9Printed Calclulation Circuits&r, &bPrinted Engineering Circuits&r, &6Printed Logic Circuits&r.
If you recall there was also &8Printed Silicon&r.
By Combining one of the 3 Ciruits, &8Printed Silicon&r and &4Redstone&r we can produce their respective proccessors:
&bPrinted Engineering Circuits&r + &8Printed Silicon&r + &4Redstone&r => &bEngineering Processor&r
&9Printed Calclulation Circuits&r + &8Printed Silicon&r + &4Redstone&r => &9Calculation Processor&r
&6Printed Logic Circuits&r + &8Printed Silicon&r + &4Redstone&r => &6Logic Processor&r

&6Tip:&r Items left in The Crafting Station will remain there even if you exit out of the GUI!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5075: &e&o"You ask yourself, it really free if I have to work for it?"
&6Hint:&r Gusters can be found in Desert Biomes
&6Hint: &rWitches can be found in Swamp Biomes
&6Hint:&r Naga can be found in Cliff Biomes
&oKill some more evil creatures for another free curio!
I am curious about these Curios! Part II
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5092: &dJEI Shortcuts:&r &e'U'&r for Usage and &e'R'&r for Recipe!

&eTip:&r It is normal to feel overwhelmed when starting a new modpack, especially one as large and comprehensive as MC Eternal. I would suggest taking your time and slowly going through the Quest Book at your own pace.
You could play the game as if it were Vanilla and slowly learn new mechanics as you progress, that way you might feel less overwhelmed from all the options.
But most importantly try to play the game in a way that you enjoy and try not to worry too much on your first playthrough!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5215: &eTip:&r The Boombox can be used to play records while moving! &oHuge in Goblin circles right now.
&oTrade with a Goblin Trader for a Boombox!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5466: &r&8(Complete all non-optional Quests in The Introduction Chapter)
&oComplete the "A New Start" chapter to unlock special treasure!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5629: It seems the tower is locked to prevent interlopers and ne'er-do-wells from entering!
Now I wonder where the key might be?
&lHEY!&r &owait a second! &rI think I remember a certain slimey member of the slime royal family having a key that resembles that lock...
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5762: The &eEccentric Tome&r is a utility item that allows you to store guide books from other mods!
Just craft the tome with a guide book and it will enter its inventory.
Then simply &dRight-Click&r to select a book and &dLeft-Click&r to return to the tome.
You can also &dSneak and Drop&r the Tome when it's transformed to remove that book from it!
I have already combined a few guide books to help get you started! Enjoy!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5818: &eTip:&r Each level of the tower expands the range of effect by 10 blocks, with a maximum height of 10.
Build the mighty Brazier tower and stop monsters from spawning nearby!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5854: The Mimic can be found rarely underground and in Dungeons.
It's deceptive nature might fool unsuspecting adventurers but you've got me to guide you! &oHurrah!
&6Hint:&r The Mimic hides under the guise as a regular chest. You can easily find a Mimic by looking for it's main tell.. &eGreen Particles&r as it always will spawn as a &dChampion Mob.
&eTip:&r Upon killing a Mimic, they will drop a &7"Curios Cache"&r
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5877: I was getting frustrated watching you run around on foot!
So I crafted you an &l&oAWESOME&r gift!
The &dWaystone&r is a special block you can place that allows you to teleport to other Waystones at the cost of &dXP
Waystones can be created &oeventually&r, but they are quite expensive and &l&oVERY&r much out of &l&oYOUR&r reach!
&eTip:&r You can find Waystones by exploring! Upon interacting with one you can teleport to and from it!
The process is a &otad expensive&r on the experience side, so I suggest using them sparingly!
I would encourage you to create some sort of other means of transport for frequent use!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest5917: The Trash Compactor can be used to generate bottles of experience for waste materials!
The Trash Compactor requires a fuel source, like coal and a waste material, like Cobblestone.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6051: Collar Tags can be used to rename your pets cheapily!
They can also be used to enchant your pets with neat enchantments!
Simply combine a pet enchanted book with a Collar Tag in an Anvil!
Or enchant it in an Enchanting Table!
There are dozens of pet enchants out there, each with different ways to customize your pets!
&6Hint:&r Right-Click the Collar Tag on your pet and hold shift to view their currently equipped tag!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6091: The &eEnchantment Library&r can be used to store excess &dEnchanted Books&r.
Inserting a book into the top slot will store every enchantment on that book in the library. Enchantments themselves are stored as "Points"
To remove an enchantment from the library, simply click on that enchantment's tile.
If the output is empty, it will generate a new enchanted book with that enchantment on it (starting at level 1).
Subsequent clicks will increase the level on the output book. Shift-Clicking will attempt to extract the max level available to the output book.
&6Hint:&r It can accept input from &eHoppers&r and others!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6201: The Illager King has ordered a large indefinite bounty for slaying dragons and claiming their heads as a trophy, they have been pillaging and destroying his settlements for far too long!
If you can slay one of these monstrous beasts you will be handsomely rewarded!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6208: The Sea Serpent is one of the most dangerous foes in the oceans diverse eco-system.
It has no natural predators and is considered an apex predator! Come prepared!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6380: &oIf you feed a Dolphin raw cod or salmon, the Dolphin can lead you to the nearest Shipwreck!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6490: Dynamic Lighting is here! Woo! Try holding a light source!
&eTip:&r You can place a torch or lantern in your off-hand to passively generate light!
&6Hint:&r You can place a Lantern on a wall to mount it to a block!
How To Survive The First Night &e(Part III Lighting)
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6719: The &dPortable Pet Sphere&r is a very useful utility item for storing pets!
You can contain any tamed pet inside the sphere and release them whenever you wish!
Wait a second.. this isn't Cobblemon Eternal!
I'm gonna catch some of them! (Don't sue me Nintendo)
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6889: The &eCurio Container&r can be used to store multiple Curios! They can be swapped quickly, making this a very &oconvenient&r item to craft!
&dNow you can collect Curios with ease!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6908: &eTip: These Chests should not be broken, they will hold new loot for other players. If you play Singleplayer, this can be ignored.
&oIn MCE2 all loot is spawned in a per player instanced chest. The loot is random for every player that finds the chest!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest6920: &dÂ§7Hello lovely! I have packed you some lunch to help with your Questing! - Mom
I have also found some items that might be useful for you while I was at the market! Some sort of &e"Unique Item"&r&d Â§7or something... I figured you would know what to do with it! XOXO
&dÂ§7PS, I saw this beautiful painting on display, I think it was called "Bold and Brash", would you like me to pick it up for you? I think it would look great in your bedroom!
Mom has sent you mail! &nÂ§aYou should open it!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest7075: The &eNo Soliciting Sign&r will prevent &dWandering Traders&r from appearing within 10 Chunks of the sign!
&7Begone! Your goods are not wanted here!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest7111: The Illager King has ordered a large indefinite bounty for slaying dragons and claiming their heads as a trophy, they have been pillaging and destroying his settlements for far too long!
If you can slay one of these monstrous beasts you will be handsomely rewarded!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest7151: &eTip:&r You need to activate the rift before you can use it, interact to activate it!
&oAfter defeating a boss, a Boss Rift will appear. By interacting with a rift you can warp home free of charge!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest7429: The &eParaglider&r can be used to safely travel in the sky!

While not the fastest way to travel, gliders are a very useful item that should be part of your toolkit! They allow you to quickly save yourself from fall damage while also granting you a new form of movement!
Jumping off cliffs or into deep ravines? Gliders got you covered!
Simply equip in your &dGlider Curio Slot&r and upon pressing spacebar mid-air you will activate your glider!
&6Hint:&r Try flying your glider in third person! It is far easier to control and looks awesome!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest7638: You can create a team by opening the &eTeam GUI&r which can be accessed by clicking a button which is located inside your inventory at the &eTOP-LEFT&r of the screen.
While in a team your Quest progress is shared! Only invite people you trust into your team!

&a&lQuestmasters Tip:&r It can sometimes get a little confusing playing with multiple people on one team, cooperation and communication is advised when completing Quests.. otherwise you may not experience gameplay as intended!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest7776: Upon summoning &eLuggage&r, they will capture your dropped items... and your heart! &dâ™¡
But most importantly of all, &eLuggage&r is a portable chest who will follow you to the ends of the Overworld!
&6Hint:&r You can strike Luggage with lightning to &7&osupercharge&r your pal!
&eTip:&r You can press &dShift + Right Click&r to pick up Luggage.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest7836: It is time. We need to enter The Nether!
The Nether is full of valuble resources, multiple Legendary Eyes among other valuble treasures to claim!
&6Hint:&r Use the Flint and Steel on the portal frame!
&4Note:&r Entering The Nether will start EXPERT MODE!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest7866: The &ePortable Crafting Table&r can be used to craft on the go! Simply &eRight-Click&r to open the &eCrafting Window!
Craft a &eCrafting Table on a Stick
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8047: You sure do love lootin' chests huh!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8202: It seems we need a mysterious object called the &6Obsidian Palantir!&r
This object &oshould&r grant us passage into The Nether! You might need to &o"handle"&r whoever is currently in possession of this artifact!
Huh... I guess things have changed...
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8323: The Wise Oak has seen just about everything there is to see..
Legend says that these ancient trees have existed since the world was first created!
Perhaps it might share some of its wisdom with you..
&6Hint:&r Wise Oak also uh.. has a very high Enchanting Power. It makes nearby Enchanting Tables produce stronger enchants... Something tells me they won't like that very much however.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8363: The Calender allows you to see more information about the season you are currently in!
The World will go through the four seasons ->
Each season affects the world in different ways such as the speed of crop growth!
Some crops are season specific so keep an eye on that!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8370: The Pet Bed when bound to a pet allows them to respawn upon dying!
They will be found sleeping peacefully in their bed the following morning!
&6Hint:&r Push a pet onto a Pet Bed to link them, you can tell if they are linked by the &7Zzz&r particles that begin appearing!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8416: Hello! You are a normal human!
That is all there is to it! Here! have an apple!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8424: &7Pssssst try to gather as many &eCockroaches&r&7 in one place before giving one a &eMaraca&r
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8465: Consider joining our Discord for support! We have a very active friendly community of over 30k users that would be happy to answer any questions you might have!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8697: &6Hint:&r&e The Living Flame&r is a very rare item that can be found in a Jungle Temple, or by killing a Crazed Illager in a Mansion!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8785: &d"The Wandering Thief"&r is an Ex Villager gone rogue. They approach their victims under the guise of a legitimate Wandering Trader, and when you least expect it... BAM! They strike! and take all of your precious items. They are wanted for the robbery of over two dozen innocent Villagers and Adventurers.
&7&o"I make ends meet.. Just like any man.. I work with my hands... If you cross my path.. I'll knock you out.. Drag you off the road.. Steal yo' shoes from off yo' feet..."
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8802: &oUncover the remains of a Wrecked Ship
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8928: The Feather on a Stick can be used to play with your pets!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest8989: These magnificent creatures can be tamed and make for a perfect aquatic companion! They have a very fast underwater speed and can be mounted by the player if tamed.
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest9079: As an orc you have increased armor and health!
But animals seem to be afraid of you for some reason?
&c&lLOOKS LIKE MEATS BACK ON THE MENU BOYS! &r&7&oor not.. maybe you are a vegetarian orc, they exist!
&eTip:&r Orcs are much slower to Combat Roll, they are simply quite clumsy!
ftbquests.chapter.introduction.quest9310: The &eCage&r can be used to capture small mobs! Very useful tool for transporting small animals!
&d&oDespite all my rage I am still just a small animal in a cage â™«

ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest10126018: Mekanism's Bio Fuel is an easy-to-obtain, early source of energy made from plant life. Any plant matter can be used as Bio Fuel, from seeds to pumpkins and melons - making it a renewable resource. Creating Bio Fuel is as easy as putting plant life into a powered Crusher. Use it in a Bio-Generator for energy or in the Pressurized Reaction Chamber to create Ethylene.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest14332341: Osmium can only be found in &eThe Great Below!
The Start of Your Mekanism Journey!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest17120581: Free Runners are the perfect way to get around those pesky 1-block inclines! No more fall damage, either - as long as they're charged, of course. A fall will reduce the charge, depending on how far it was.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest18713119: The Nutritional Liquifier is the perfect way to turn those pesky consumable food items into delicious Nutritional Paste! Just pop it into the left UI slot, and watch the magic happen. It can hold a total of 10000mB of paste before it is full and halts production, so you can always be sure you've got a tasty treat on hand. The nutritional paste is used by the MekaSuit Helmet and the Canteen for feeding the player without having to carry physical individual food items in their inventory, so you can rest assured you'll never go hungry again!
A Balanced Diet in a Can; Now Soylent-Free!*
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest38958610: Looking for an all-in-one tool that does the work of a pickaxe, axe, and shovel? Look no further than Mekanism's Atomic Disassembler! This electronic paxel has five settings that can be cycled through by crouching and scrolling your mouse's scroll wheel or using the Item mode switch keybind, making it the perfect tool for any job. Plus, it's a great weapon against mobs!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest41142483: The Metallurgic Infuser will be one of your most used machines when playing with Mekanism. It will be needed to create Steel Ingots, various Infused Alloys, and various Circuits. All of these are necessary if you want to progress in Mekanism.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest42973327: Mekanism's Configurator is the perfect tool for customizing your machines. With several modes to choose from, you can customize your machines to your heart's content. The Configurator comes with four modes: Configurate, Empty, Rotate, and Wrench.
You can easily switch between modes by crouching and scrolling up or down with your mouse's scroll wheel.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest70148307: The Enrichment Chamber is a machine that uses energy to extract dusts out of certain blocks and ores, making it essential to multiply your ingot production. Not to be mistaken with the Crusher, this machine is the pulverizer equivalent in other mods.
The Enrichment Chamber can also be used to turn various resources into their refined variants, all to improve the efficiency of the Metallurgic Infuser.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest71015759: The Flamethrower is a ranged weapon which uses Hydrogen gas as its fuel. It's great for barbecuing mobs - just make sure to get them nice and crispy! It's most effective on large groups of mobs, where the user can hose down the entire group with fuel at a short distance.
The Best Way to Light Up Your Life!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest74243419: The Scuba Tank is a great way to extend your stay underwater- just make sure you have a full tank of oxygen and your Gas Mask on and you're good to go!
Dive Into the Deep End With Top-Of-The-Line Scuba Gear!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest75414362: The Jetpack is perfect for those who want to take to the skies! It uses Hydrogen gas as a fuel and can store up to 24,000 mB. Depending on your needs, you can toggle between three modes--Regular, Hover, and Disabled--. Plus, it displays the Hydrogen remaining and the mode active in the bottom left corner. So take flight today with the Jetpack!
The Future of Flying Is Here!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest80849699: Did you know that the Jetpack can't be worn with chestplate armor? Well, now you do! But don't worry, you can upgrade to the Armored Jetpack if you want protection. Plus, when used with a pair of Free Runners, you safely disable it without worrying about fall damage!
The Next Level in Personal Security!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest81801908: This electric bow is perfect for those who want to add a little zing to their arrows.
The Perfect Way to Shoot Arrows Without All That Pesky Manual Labor!
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.quest86694902: The Anchor Upgrade is a machine upgrade which keeps the chunk of the machine to which it is applied loaded. This is helpful for machines like the Digital Miner and Teleporter Portal which must be in loaded chunks to function properly.
Only the Digital Miner, Teleporter Portal and the Quantum Entangloporter can have the Anchor Upgrade installed.
ftbquests.chapter.mekanism.title: &7Mekanism (I)
ftbquests.chapter.mining.quest4971210052: You might have taken note of the fact that they're &6Rare&r though, and you might be thinking "&7&ooh great, that'll be fun to try and find...&r", and you'd be right! Fortunately, the mod has mechanics to locate them!
And before you think about using some kind of &2Biome Locator&r to find them, don't, it won't work. &eAlex's Caves&r wants you to &dinteract with its own mechanics&r, not just skip over them.

ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest265130425: The Crescent Hammer is a necessary tool for any aspiring engineer! It allows easy rotation of machines with a simple right-click!

ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest331126509: Increase the range of machines and equipment by an additional block in all directions!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest368629217: Auto-Input and Auto-Output control the behavior of how the machine's faces interact with the adjacent blocks.

Auto-Input will pull from the adjacent blocks on the sides set to input. This means that if there is a chest on a face that is set to input with Auto-Input on, the machine will automactically bring the contents from the chest into the machine.
Auto-Output works the same as Auto-Input. However, it pushes resources from the internal output slot into the inventories of adjacent blocks instead of pulling.

The top/bottom and left/right panels around the center panel control the top/bottom and left/right faces respectively.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest882880105: Increases the level of a potion effect, but at the cost of duration!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest891888399: Fluxducts can be used to transport power. Fluxducts automatically pull energy from dynamos and push energy into machines.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest898308539: The Fluid Encapsulator &ncombines fluids with blocks and items&r! You can make several interesting recipes this way and can even &nfill buckets and bottles automatically&r!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest906727030: Redstone Flux Limiters can be attached to fluxducts to limit the transfer of energy!
ftbquests.chapter.thermal.quest968239353: Stores power to automatically recharge other equipment! Can be upgraded with augments!

ftbquests.chapter.vampirism__hunter.ques: Go inside the trainers house and use the special chair inside to inject your that garlic vaccination. It will make you immune to the Vampire's poisonous "Sanguinare Vampiris" bite.This is more or less the only advantage that you will have at that level. But you can train yourself to become stronger and learn some useful skills.
